info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 7:51AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Stephens, Habersham, Rabun and west central Oconee Counties through 830 AM EDT... At 751 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles south of Cleveland, or near Clermont, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clayton, Clarkesville, Toccoa, Cornelia, Baldwin, Demorest, Mount Airy, Alto, Mountain City and Tiger. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
